intro: Dolichandrone cauda-felina, commonly known as the cat's tail plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated inflorescences that resemble a cat's tail. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters along the stem. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Dolichandrone cauda-felina prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
